Test: Coverage

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2021-01-20

Source: vignettes/tests/test_coverage.Rmd
test_coverage.Rmd
library(testthat)
library(ramR)
A <- S <- matrix(
  0,
  ncol = 3,
  nrow = 2
)
test_that("E_num: square.", {
  expect_error(
    E_num(A)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽ‰
test_that("E_sym: square.", {
  expect_error(
    E_sym(A)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥‡
test_that("C_num: S is a square matrix.", {
  expect_error(
    C_num(A, S)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ˜€
test_that("C_sym: S is a square matrix.", {
  expect_error(
    C_sym(A, S)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽŠ
test_that("S_num: A is a square matrix.", {
  expect_error(
    S_num(A, C)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥³
test_that("S_sym: A is a square matrix.", {
  expect_error(
    S_sym(A, C)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥‡
S <- matrix(
  0,
  ncol = 3,
  nrow = 3
)
test_that("C_num: A and S have the same dimensions.", {
  expect_error(
    C_num(A, S)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ˜¸
test_that("C_sym: A and S have the same dimensions.", {
  expect_error(
    C_sym(A, S)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ˜¸
A <- matrix(
  0,
  ncol = 3,
  nrow = 3
)
C <- matrix(
  0,
  ncol = 3,
  nrow = 2
)
test_that("S_num: A and C have the same dimensions.", {
  expect_error(
    S_num(A, C)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŒˆ
test_that("S_sym: A and C have the same dimensions.", {
  expect_error(
    S_sym(A, C)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽ‰
A <- matrix(
  data = c(0, -1, -1, 0),
  nrow = 2,
  ncol = 2
)
test_that("E_num: singular.", {
  expect_error(
    E_num(A)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŒˆ
model <- "
  # VARIABLE1 OPERATION VARIABLE2 LABEL
  e           by        y         1;
  y           on        x         beta;
  e           with      e         sigma[varepsilon]^2;
  x           with      x         sigma[x]^2;
"
eq2ram(model)
#> $A
#>   y   x      e  
#> y "0" "beta" "1"
#> x "0" "0"    "0"
#> e "0" "0"    "0"
#> 
#> $S
#>   y   x            e                    
#> y "0" "0"          "0"                  
#> x "0" "sigma[x]^2" "0"                  
#> e "0" "0"          "sigma[varepsilon]^2"
#> 
#> $filter
#>   y x e
#> y 1 0 0
#> x 0 1 0
#> 
#> $u
#> NULL
